critique: This executive order focuses on improving educational outcomes for Hispanic students. It establishes a White House Initiative and a Presidential Advisory Commission to address the educational challenges faced by this community. The order emphasizes expanding educational opportunities, increasing college access, and fostering family and community engagement. There is a strong emphasis on diversity and inclusion, as well as a focus on improving the competitiveness of the United States in the global economy by enhancing the educational attainment of Hispanics. The order does not appear to restrict civil liberties or expand executive power significantly. It seems to promote federal involvement in education, but not in a way that overrides state control. It also doesn't touch on immigration. It promotes government intervention in education to address inequality.
